item.title: Are there any games for linux?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

WINE also has excellent support for DirectX games.

I have used both cedega (formerly winex) and WINE, and I find WINE much more up to date and more compatible.

Read full topic

item.title: Are there any games for linux?
item.dc:creator: @error.login cane
item.description:
@error.login wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:4, topic:176812”]All ID Software games:

Enemy Territory: Quake Wars
Quake, Quake 2, Quake 3, Quake 4
Doom, Doom 2, Doom 3

All Unreal tournament games (UT3 linux client is not out yet)

Postal 2, X2, America’s Army, many many more. Here are some torrents I have acquired: http://moparisthebest.com/linuxtorrents/

Oh, and yes, the games run much better on linux than windows as well. :)[/quote]
k il check them out now

Read full topic
item.source: Are there any games for linux?

item.title: Are there any games for linux?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:7, topic:176812”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=237583.msg2020501#msg2020501 date=1201583129]
Oh, and yes, the games run much better on linux than windows as well.
[/quote]

Even though most GPU drivers are sub-standard and most ID games are missing optimizations present in the Windows builds?[/quote]

The only time I have had driver problems was with my laptop which had an ATI Radeon 9600 mobile, with all of my nvidia cards the graphics are excellent (from the Riva TNT2 w/ 8mb RAM to the 8800GTX w/ 640mb RAM) A comparison I can bring to the table right now is that with ET:QW, in windows XP (Vista is much worse, as you can imagine) it takes about 2-3 minutes to load a map, whereas the same computer running linux loads the same map in about 20-30 seconds.

Read full topic
item.source: Are there any games for linux?

item.title: Are there any games for linux?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Oh, and yes, the games run much better on linux than windows as well.

Even though most GPU drivers are sub-standard and most ID games are missing optimisations present in the Windows builds?

@ OP: Don’t forget many games will run under Wine, also, the best supported IMO being my personal favourite World of Warcraft

Read full topic

item.title: Are there any games for linux?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

All ID Software games:

Enemy Territory: Quake Wars
Quake, Quake 2, Quake 3, Quake 4
Doom, Doom 2, Doom 3

All Unreal tournament games (UT3 linux client is not out yet)

Postal 2, X2, America’s Army, many many more. Here are some torrents I have acquired: http://moparisthebest.com/linuxtorrents/

Oh, and yes, the games run much better on linux than windows as well.
